revision.text:
'''Dame Josephine Barstow''' was born on [[September 27]], [[1940]] in [[Sheffield]].
She is an [[English]] [[soprano]], who possesses an flexible and expressive voice which she uses to great effect to produce a very distinctive and personal sound, which is instantly recognisable.
She is also an extremely gifted and intelligent actress. This combination of acting and voice makes her one of the most powerful performers on the operatic stage.
She was created a [[DBE]] in [[1995]].

She is also an extremely gifted and intelligent actress. This combination of acting and voice makes her one of the most powerful performers on the operatic stage.
She was created a [[DBE]] in [[1995]].

revision.text:
'''Dame Josephine Barstow''' [[Order of the British Empire|DBE]] (born [[September 27]], [[1940]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
Barstow was born in [[Sheffield]]. She was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] (DBE) in 1995.
== External link == *[http://www.geocities.com/Vienna/Strasse/1523/barstow.htm Chronology, roles, discography, etc.]
{{UK-singer-stub}} {{opera-singer-stub}}
[[Category:1940 births|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:English opera singers|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Living people|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:People from Sheffield|Barstow, Jospehine]]

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]], [[CBE]]''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
She began her career touring with ''[[Opera for All]]'' and then won a scholarship to study for one year at the [[London Opera Centre]] where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). Very soon she was singing "Euridice" and "Violetta" for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and the following year began a three-year contract with the Welsh National Company. After having been invited to sing "Violetta" in a new and very successful production of ''[[La Traviata]]'' with the [[English National Opera]] (ENO), she began a long relationship with the ENO. She has also sung with the [[Royal Opera Covent Garden]], notably as "Denise" in the world premiere of ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' by Sir [[Michael Tippett]].
She has returned there regularly over the years for roles such as "Salome", "Ellen Orford", "Helena" from ''[[A Midsummer Night’s Dream]]'', "Santuzza", "Leonore", "Alice", "Lady Macbeth", et al.
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].
== External link == *[http://www.geocities.com/Vienna/Strasse/1523/barstow.htm] *[http://www.musichall.uk.com/pages/sop_JB/resume.htm]
[[Category:1940 births|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:English opera singers|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Living people|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:People from Sheffield|Barstow, Josephine]]
{{UK-singer-stub}} {{opera-singer-stub}}

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]], [[CBE]]''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
She began her career touring with ''[[Opera for All]]'' and then won a scholarship to study for one year at the [[London Opera Centre]] where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). Very soon she was singing "Euridice" and "Violetta" for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and the following year began a three-year contract with the Welsh National Company. After having been invited to sing "Violetta" in a new and very successful production of ''[[La Traviata]]'' with the [[English National Opera]] (ENO), she began a long relationship with the ENO. She has also sung with the [[Royal Opera Covent Garden]], notably as "Denise" in the world premiere of ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' by Sir [[Michael Tippett]].
She has returned there regularly over the years for roles such as "Salome", "Ellen Orford", "Helena" from ''[[A Midsummer's Night Dream]]'', "Santuzza", "Leonore", "Alice", "Lady Macbeth", et al.
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]], [[CBE]]''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
She began her career touring with ''[[Opera for All]]'' and then won a scholarship to study for one year at the [[London Opera Centre]] where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). Very soon she was singing "Euridice" and "Violetta" for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and the following year began a three-year contract with the Welsh National Company.
After having been invited to sing "Violetta" in a new and very successful production of ''[[La Traviata]]'' with the [[English National Opera]] (ENO), she began a long relationship with the ENO. She has also sung with the [[Royal Opera House]] in [[Covent Garden]], notably as "Denise" in the world premiere of ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' by Sir [[Michael Tippett]].
She has returned there regularly over the years for roles such as "Salome", "Ellen Orford", "Helena" from ''[[A Midsummer's Night Dream]]'', "Santuzza", "Leonore", "Alice", "Lady Macbeth", et al.
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].

[[Category:1940 births|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:English opera singers|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Living people|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:People from Sheffield|Barstow, Josephine]]
{{UK-singer-stub}} {{opera-singer-stub}}

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]],''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
== Education and early career == Dame Josephine was educated at the [[University of Birmingham]] and made her professional debut (Mimì in ''[[La bohème]]'') with the touring company ''[[Opera for All]]'' in 1964. She won a scholarship to study during 1965-6 at the [[London Opera Centre]], where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). During the following season, she sang [[Gluck]]'s Euridice and [[Verdi]]'s Violetta for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and in 1968 she began a three-year contract with [[Welsh National Opera]]. In 1969 she made her [[Royal Opera, London|Royal Opera]] debut as one of the Nieces in ''[[Peter Grimes]]''
== Subsequent career ==
Among other roles with the Royal Opera, she has sung Alice Ford (''[[Falstaff]]''), Santuzza (''[[Cavalleria rusticana]]''), Ellen Orford in ''Peter Grimes'', Leonore (''[[Fidelio]]'') and the Old Countess (''[[The Queen of Spades (opera)|The Queen of Spades]]''). She also appeared as Denise and Gayle, respectively, in the world premières of Sir [[Michael Tippett]]'s ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' and ''[[The Ice Break]]'', respectively.
At [[Glyndebourne Festival Opera|Glyndebourne]], she has appeared as Lady Macbeth, Elettra in ''[[Idomeneo]]'' and Leonore.
Roles with [[English National Opera]] include an acclaimed Violetta, Emilia Marty (''[[The Makropulos Case]]''), Natasha in the British stage première of ''[[War and Peace (Prokofiev)|War and Peace]]'' and the title roles in ''[[Salome]], [[Aida]], [[Arabella]], [[Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk]] and [[Der Rosenkavalier]]''.
Latterly, she has appeared with [[Opera North]] as Alice Ford, Lady Macbeth, Kostelnicka in ''[[Jenůfa]]'', Marie in ''[[Wozzeck]]'', Lady Billows in ''[[Albert Herring]]'' and in the title roles of ''[[Gloriana]]'', ''[[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]]'' and ''Aida''.
== Honours ==
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].
== External links == *[http://www.geocities.com/Vienna/Strasse/1523/barstow.htm Roles and discography] *[http://www.musichall.uk.com/pages/sop_JB/resume.htm Resumé]
[[Category:1940 births|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:English opera singers|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Living people|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:People from Sheffield|Barstow, Josephine]]
{{UK-singer-stub}} {{opera-singer-stub}}

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]],''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
== Education and early career == Dame Josephine was educated at the [[University of Birmingham]] and made her professional debut (Mimì in ''[[La bohème]]'') with the touring company ''[[Opera for All]]'' in 1964. She won a scholarship to study during 1965-6 at the [[London Opera Centre]], where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). During the following season, she sang [[Gluck]]'s Euridice and [[Verdi]]'s Violetta for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and in 1968 she began a three-year contract with [[Welsh National Opera]]. In 1969 she made her [[Royal Opera, London|Royal Opera]] debut as one of the Nieces in ''[[Peter Grimes]]''
== Subsequent career ==
Among other roles with the Royal Opera, she has sung Alice Ford (''[[Falstaff]]''), Santuzza (''[[Cavalleria rusticana]]''), Ellen Orford in ''Peter Grimes'', Leonore (''[[Fidelio]]'') and the Old Countess (''[[The Queen of Spades (opera)|The Queen of Spades]]''). She also appeared as Denise and Gayle, respectively, in the world premières of Sir [[Michael Tippett]]'s ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' and ''[[The Ice Break]]'', respectively.
At [[Glyndebourne Festival Opera|Glyndebourne]], she has appeared as Lady Macbeth, Elettra in ''[[Idomeneo]]'' and Leonore.
Roles with [[English National Opera]] include an acclaimed Violetta, Emilia Marty (''[[The Makropulos Case]]''), Natasha in the British stage première of ''[[War and Peace (Prokofiev)|War and Peace]]'' and the title roles in ''[[Salome]], [[Aida]], [[Arabella]], [[Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk]] and [[Der Rosenkavalier]]''.
Latterly, she has appeared with [[Opera North]] as Alice Ford, Lady Macbeth, Kostelnicka in ''[[Jenůfa]]'', Marie in ''[[Wozzeck]]'', Lady Billows in ''[[Albert Herring]]'' and in the title roles of ''[[Gloriana]]'', ''[[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]]'' and ''Aida''.
== Honours ==
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]],''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
== Education and early career == Dame Josephine was educated at the [[University of Birmingham]] and made her professional debut (Mimì in ''[[La bohème]]'') with the touring company ''[[Opera for All]]'' in 1964. She won a scholarship to study during 1965-6 at the [[London Opera Centre]], where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). During the following season, she sang [[Gluck]]'s Euridice and [[Verdi]]'s Violetta for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and in 1968 she began a three-year contract with [[Welsh National Opera]]. In 1969 she made her [[Royal Opera, London|Royal Opera]] debut as one of the Nieces in ''[[Peter Grimes]]''
== Subsequent career ==
Among other roles with the Royal Opera, she has sung Alice Ford (''[[Falstaff]]''), Santuzza (''[[Cavalleria rusticana]]''), Ellen Orford in ''Peter Grimes'', Leonore (''[[Fidelio]]'') and the Old Countess (''[[The Queen of Spades (opera)|The Queen of Spades]]''). She also appeared as Denise and Gayle, respectively, in the world premières of Sir [[Michael Tippett]]'s ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' and ''[[The Ice Break]]'', respectively.
At [[Glyndebourne Festival Opera|Glyndebourne]], she has appeared as Lady Macbeth, Elettra in ''[[Idomeneo]]'' and Leonore.
Roles with [[English National Opera]] include an acclaimed Violetta, Emilia Marty (''[[The Makropulos Case]]''), Natasha in the British stage première of ''[[War and Peace (Prokofiev)|War and Peace]]'' and the title roles in ''[[Salome]], [[Aida]], [[Arabella]], [[Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk]] and [[Der Rosenkavalier]]''.
Among other engagements outside the British Isles, she has appeared at the [[New York City|New York]] [[Metropolitan Opera]], the [[Chicago]] [[Lyric Opera of Chicago|Lyric Opera]], the [[Vienna State Opera]] and the [[Bayreuth Festival]].
Latterly, she has performed a number of roles with [[Opera North]], including Alice Ford, Lady Macbeth, Kostelnicka in ''[[Jenůfa]]'', Marie in ''[[Wozzeck]]'', Lady Billows in ''[[Albert Herring]]'' and in the title roles of ''[[Gloriana]]'', ''[[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]]'' and ''Aida''.
== Honours ==
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].
== References == *''Who's Who in British Opera'' ed. Nicky Adam (Scolar Press, 1993) ISBN 0 859 67 894 6 == External links == *[http://www.geocities.com/Vienna/Strasse/1523/barstow.htm Roles and discography] *[http://www.musichall.uk.com/pages/sop_JB/resume.htm Resumé]

Among other engagements outside the British Isles, she has appeared at the [[New York City|New York]] [[Metropolitan Opera]], the [[Chicago]] [[Lyric Opera of Chicago|Lyric Opera]], the [[Vienna State Opera]] and the [[Bayreuth Festival]].
Latterly, she has performed a number of roles with [[Opera North]], including Alice Ford, Lady Macbeth, Kostelnicka in ''[[Jenůfa]]'', Marie in ''[[Wozzeck]]'', Lady Billows in ''[[Albert Herring]]'' and in the title roles of ''[[Gloriana]]'', ''[[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]]'' and ''Aida''.
== Selected recordings == *''[[Albert Herring]]'' (conductor [[Steuart Bedford]]), 1996, Naxos *''[[Gloriana]]'' (conductor [[Charles Mackerras]]), 1993, Decca *''[[The Knot Garden]]'' (conductor [[Colin Davis]]), 1974, Philips *''[[Un ballo in maschera]]'' (conductor [[Herbert von Karajan]]), 1989, DG *''[[Street Scene (opera)|Street Scene]]'' (conductor [[John Mauceri]]), 1991, Decca
*''Opera Finales'' (''[[Salome (opera)|Salome]], [[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]], [[The Makropulos Affair]], [[Turandot]]'') (conductor John Mauceri), 1990, Decca == Honours ==
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].
== References == *''Who's Who in British Opera'' ed. Nicky Adam (Scolar Press, 1993) ISBN 0 859 67 894 6 == External links == *[http://www.geocities.com/Vienna/Strasse/1523/barstow.htm Roles and discography] *[http://www.musichall.uk.com/pages/sop_JB/resume.htm Resumé]
[[Category:1940 births|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:English opera singers|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Living people|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire|Barstow, Josephine]] [[Category:People from Sheffield|Barstow, Josephine]]

'''Dame Josephine Barstow, [[DBE]],''' (b. [[September 27]] [[1940]], [[Sheffield, England]]) is an [[English people|English]] [[soprano]].
== Education and early career == Dame Josephine was educated at the [[University of Birmingham]] and made her professional debut (Mimì in ''[[La bohème]]'') with the touring company ''[[Opera for All]]'' in 1964. She won a scholarship to study during 1965-6 at the [[London Opera Centre]], where she met her husband Ande Anderson (d. [[1996]]). During the following season, she sang [[Gluck]]'s Euridice and [[Verdi]]'s Violetta for the [[Sadlers Wells]] Opera Company and in 1968 she began a three-year contract with [[Welsh National Opera]]. In 1969 she made her [[Royal Opera, London|Royal Opera]] debut as one of the Nieces in ''[[Peter Grimes]]''
== Subsequent career ==
Among other roles with the Royal Opera, she has sung Alice Ford (''[[Falstaff]]''), Santuzza (''[[Cavalleria rusticana]]''), Ellen Orford in ''Peter Grimes'', Leonore (''[[Fidelio]]'') and the Old Countess (''[[The Queen of Spades (opera)|The Queen of Spades]]''). She also appeared as Denise and Gayle, respectively, in the world premières of Sir [[Michael Tippett]]'s ''[[The Knot Garden]]'' and ''[[The Ice Break]]'', respectively.
At [[Glyndebourne Festival Opera|Glyndebourne]], she has appeared as Lady Macbeth, Elettra in ''[[Idomeneo]]'' and Leonore.
Roles with [[English National Opera]] include an acclaimed Violetta, Emilia Marty (''[[The Makropulos Case]]''), Natasha in the British stage première of ''[[War and Peace (Prokofiev)|War and Peace]]'' and the title roles in ''[[Salome]], [[Aida]], [[Arabella]], [[Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk]] and [[Der Rosenkavalier]]''.
Among other engagements outside the British Isles, she has appeared at the [[New York City|New York]] [[Metropolitan Opera]], the [[Chicago]] [[Lyric Opera of Chicago|Lyric Opera]], the [[Vienna State Opera]] and the [[Bayreuth Festival]].
Latterly, she has performed a number of roles with [[Opera North]], including Alice Ford, Lady Macbeth, Kostelnicka in ''[[Jenůfa]]'', Marie in ''[[Wozzeck]]'', Lady Billows in ''[[Albert Herring]]'' and in the title roles of ''[[Gloriana]]'', ''[[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]]'' and ''Aida''.
== Selected recordings == === CDs === *''[[Albert Herring]]'' (conductor [[Steuart Bedford]]), 1996, Naxos *''[[Un ballo in maschera]]'' (conductor [[Herbert von Karajan]]), 1989, DG *''[[Gloriana]]'' (conductor [[Charles Mackerras]]), 1993, Decca *''[[The Knot Garden]]'' (conductor [[Colin Davis]]), 1974, Philips *''[[Street Scene (opera)|Street Scene]]'' (conductor [[John Mauceri]]), 1991, Decca
*''Opera Finales'' (''[[Salome (opera)|Salome]], [[Médée (Cherubini)|Médée]], [[The Makropulos Affair]], [[Turandot]]'') (conductor John Mauceri), 1990, Decca === DVDs === *''[[Gloriana]]'' (conductor [[Paul Daniel]]), 2000, Opus Arte *''[[Idomeneo]]'' (conductor [[John Pritchard (conductor)|John Pritchard]]), 1974, Arthaus Musik *''[[Macbeth (opera)|Macbeth]]'' (conductor John Pritchard), 1972, Arthaus Musik
== Honours ==
Josephine Barstow was created a [[Order of the British Empire|Dame Commander of the British Empire]] in [[1995]].
